thread.title: Murder investigation launched after boy, 15, stabbed to death in London
thread.title_full: Murder investigation launched after boy, 15, stabbed to death in London

author: Chris Baynes
title: Murder investigation launched after boy, 15, stabbed to death in London
text:
Murder investigation launched after boy, 15, stabbed to death in London The teenager was found stabbed in Willesden, north-west London, at 3.30pm today and died later in hospital Share Get daily updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Police have launched a murder investigation after a 15-year-old boy was knifed to death in north-west London. 
The teenager was found stabbed in Doyle Gardens, Willesden, just before 3.30pm today. 
Paramedics took him to hospital but he later died. 
Police have cordoned off the road and witnesses said a forensics team was on the scene tonight. 
A Metropolitan Police spokesman said officers were called by the London Ambulance Service. 
He added: "Officers attended and the boy was suffering stab wounds. The boy was taken by LAS to hospital where he was later pronounced dead. Next of kin are aware. Read More 
"The Homicide and Major Crime Command has been informed and are investigating. 
"Whilst officers believe they know who the deceased is, they await formal identification." 
Anyone with any information is urged to contact police by calling 101 or tweeting @MetCC Information can also be passed anonymously to Crimestoppers on 0800 555 111 or at crimestoppers-uk.org . Like us on Facebook
